body.p: The IASB considered comments from respondents to the Discussion Paper and the 2010 and 2013 Exposure Drafts, and from participants at consultation meetings (including meetings with users of financial statements) as described in paragraphs BC9 and BC13. In the light of these comments, the IASB concluded that there would be significant benefits from requiring a lessee to recognise right-of-use assets and lease liabilities for all leases (except short-term leases and leases of low-value assets as described in paragraphs BC87–BC104), particularly for users of financial statements and others who have raised concerns about the extent of off balance sheet financing provided through operating leases.
